feed.title: Brad Jasper, Raleigh Full-stack Software Developer

entry.title: A guide to Graphite and StatsD
Left
entry.content:
Left is a clean, whitespace-happy layout for Jekyll.

This is designed to be an easy layout to modify for your own blog. It was extracted from zachholman.com, which means it was battle-hardened from years of posting serious blog posts about emoji and swear words.

You’re actually reading an example post right now. See how cool it is? Oh, be quiet, you’re making me blush.

You’ll want to get the code and read the README to learn how to install and set up Left for your own purposes.

def foo
  puts 'foo'
end

If you have any questions, follow and ping me on Twitter- I’m @holman.

entry.title: Embedding 3rd Party Widgets in Hostile CSS Environments
entry.content:
If you’ve ever written a 3rd party widget that’s embeded in another website, you may have run up against styling your widget in a hostile CSS environment.

The problem is you’ve written CSS to work one way, but as soon as it’s injected into another website environment it begins to break.

This is because every website has different CSS rules, and you can’t possible test all of them on your own.

Until now, introducing the
